meanings.definition: Deceptive or false talk or behavior
meanings.sent1: The salesman's humbug about the magical properties of the product fooled many customers.
meanings.sent2: Don't believe the humbug you hear from those trying to scam you.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's humbug about being an alien from Mars had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: The politician's promises turned out to be nothing but empty humbug.
meanings.sent5: The teacher exposed the student's humbug about finishing the assignment.

meanings.sent1: I don't have time for your humbug, just tell me the truth.
meanings.sent2: Stop filling my head with humbug and give me some real facts.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled at the humbug story of a talking cat.
meanings.sent4: The idea of flying pigs is pure humbug, it will never happen.
meanings.sent5: His explanation for the missing cookies was nothing but humbug.

meanings.definition: A person who deceives or tricks others
meanings.sent1: Be careful of that humbug, he will try to cheat you out of your money.
meanings.sent2: The con artist was known as a master humbug in the city.
meanings.sent3: The little boy thought he could be a humbug and sneak extra candy.
meanings.sent4: She saw through the humbug's disguise and exposed his true identity.
meanings.sent5: The humbug pretended to be a wealthy businessman to gain trust.
